channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In France, Drug Traffic Spreads to Small Towns
item.description: Even quaint corners of the country are seeing a rise in drug violence and crime. Just ask the mayor of Morlaix, which has a population of about 15,000...

item.title: How the Islamic State Radicalizes People Today
item.description: A man who pledged allegiance to the terrorist group carried out a deadly attack in New Orleans on New Year’s Day.

item.title: Pfizer has increased prices on over 60 drugs in the U.S. as of Jan. 1
item.description: The U.S. continues to charge significantly higher prices for prescription drugs compared with similarly wealthy countries.

item.title: In Kosovo, Christian Converts Hope to Revive a Pre-Islamic Past
item.description: Christian converts in Kosovo, where the vast majority of people are Muslim, hope to revive a pre-Islamic past they see as a key to their European iden...

item.title: State Dept. Tells Congress It Plans to Send $8 Billion in Arms to Israel
item.description: The arms transfer could be the final one the Biden administration provides to Israel. President Biden has largely ignored critics of Israel’s war in G...

item.title: Honduran Leader Threatens to Push U.S. Military Out of Base if Trump Orders Mass Deportations
item.description: In pushing back against President-elect Donald J. Trump’s plan, President Xiomara Castro threatened that a base hosting U.S. troops could “lose all re...

item.title: South Korean Unrest Conspiracy Theories Are Spread by Social Media
item.description: Right-wing YouTube​rs helped President Yoon Suk Yeol​ win his election. They are now his allies in the wake of his botched imposition of martial law.

item.title: Tornado Confirmed in Northern California
item.description: A warning covering an area with about 2,200 residents told people to take shelter because flying debris was expected.

item.title: Park City’s wealthiest guests are furious after $20,000 ski trips became a disaster, and now investors are bailing
item.description: Ski patrollers went on strike during the busiest time of year as they negotiated for better wages and benefits.

item.description: In pushing back against President-elect Donald J. Trump’s plan, President Xiomara Castro threatened that a base hosting U.S. troops could “lose all re...

item.title: Despite Blocked US Steel Bid, Japan Won’t Stop Seeking American Deals
item.description: Japanese companies needing to grow have sought out American deals. Experts say that will not change even after Biden’s rejection of Nippon Steel’s tak...

item.title: Getty Images explores merger with rival Shutterstock
item.description: Getty Images closed up 13% to $2.39 in New York trading Friday, giving the company a market value of $983 million.

item.title: Bird flu could merge with seasonal flu to make mutated virus that could spread among humans, CDC warns
item.description: The 2024–25 flu shot doesn’t prevent H5N1 bird flu but could play a pivotal role in preventing a pandemic.

item.title: Microsoft president says AI is ‘the electricity of our age’ as company prepares to hit $80 billion spend
item.description: Microsoft is on pace to invest about $80 billion this year to build out AI datacenters, train AI models and deploy cloud-based applications around the...
